answers.answer: Mines was a breeze i walked around some the next day at the hospital to see my baby in the nicu. And when i took him home it was so much better especially with the help of my husband. It was kinda hard for me to poop but i started back drinking coffee regularly so after a bit it was a normal flow. My bleeding only lasted about 3 to 4 weeks and not heavily blood either. The meds helped me a bunch also. Hope you feel better soon

I also had a very tough recovery. I had a section for the same reason. Failure to thrive in Labour. I couldn't move for a few days and once I got home and the removed my staples my incision burst open and I had to call an ambulance. Lots of post hospital visits to take care of the incision and couldn't do much for almost 3 weeks. It is hard because you can't care for your baby the way you would like but it does get easier. Just know your baby will not remember and you have to take cars of you before you can take Cate of baby. I am onto my third baby and another c section and the recovery gets easier each time. Good luck momma.
Disregard all my spelling errors lol

This is my third Csection so I'm use to it.. The only way you are going to get better is to think positive at all times. Ik it's easy said than done but true keep focusing on your Beatiful baby and also motivate your self to exercise with your baby by taking "Mommy and Me classes" At the YMCA.. You'll do GREAT just stay positive u made a beautiful baby Be Proud the rest won't even matter you'll see!

2 years ago I too had a c section with my firstborn. I was in labor for 24 hours and never dialated :-(  my recovery went pretty well. I did shake with chills right after  waking up from surgery which made it hard to hold my baby. Also, I  did well with the pain until day 3. That's when my first tear dropped from the pain ..wheww. A few Motrin and I was up walking the halls again. I took it slow and recovered pretty .thankfully, i was still able to do everything for baby. The bleeding lasted about  2 weeks! Pray you heal fast! Rest up.

Congrats on baby....I'm so sorry that your experience was a bad one...I've heard that it can go either way so I'm definitely thankful for my outcome. I had a csection with my first baby last summer and it was the.best experience ever and was a breeze despite what I was told to anticipate. I'm actually looking forward to my scheduled csection in February 2015. The first csection was decided after 19 hrs of unproductive labor. I was literally walking and tending to my baby (i kept her in the room with hubby and i) by 5am the.next morning (baby delivered at 5:11pm the day before) and I experienced no bleeding or spotting at all until my period returned months weeks later. I was initially worried that the csection would immobilize me since i'm short and super plus so I was already carrying a huge amount of body weight and belly even before baby however that didn't effect anything at all (I was shocked)...I barely even have a trace of a scar now and it healed super fast. Thankfully my body was functioning back to normal within days...I had the baby Thursday and by Monday I was back to business as usual since my husband went back to work that Tuesday for a 12 hr 7 day schedule for MONTHS and I had no other family to help. Now, I will say getting into the groove as a ftm wasn't too easy moving with baby but I pushed myself and it was easy by Wednesday morning...shucks...I had no choice.Congrats again on baby and I'm glad to hear that things have gotten better and you're able to enjoy baby...I can imagine that it must've been hard emotionally and physically.

I had a c-section with my first 4 years ago. I went in to be induced and over 24 hours later, 11 days past my due date, I still wasn't dilating. Recovery wasn't terrible. This time I've been assured they will want me to get up and move sooner and the cath will be removed sooner. I have no problem with the repeat c section I'm having on Wednesday. I'm sorry your experience wasn't ideal. :(

I had a csection in April for failure to progress labor. Recovery wasn't too bad until I was discharged. I had such horrible pain for the 1st 2 weeks, my incision started to get infected. It was horrible. I'm 16weeks with baby #3 (had an oops in July) Dr asked if I want to deliver vaginal or csection, hoping to be able to go vaginal, much easier recovery.
Mine was super easy the first time,  I'm sorry yours was so tough :(

Im sry to hear you had such a rough recovering Lucy. I had a cesarean 3 years, ago and I too think it was the worst experience of my life I stayed in hospital 4 days got up and walked a little the next day but only to go to the bathroom it was awful. Im hoping my vbac is successful! I really dont want another cesarean. But it seems im developing preeclampsia so Idk what's going to happen now :-(

I had a c section 7 yrs ago and 20 wks along with the second. I am happybi ended up with a c section after all that pain, dilating to 9 only to find out I had to be cut anyway. It was hard first two days or so getting out of bed, and then son was in nicu so difficult to go c him as often as I'd liked. But over all vagina in tact, no scar tissue, no having to rinse after urinating, no pain on bowel movements...im good for the next!! Sorry urs didnt go as well

Thanks everyone for sharing your stories. I think everything was just a shock to me as i wasnt prepared at all for it. I had spent the whole pregnancy preparing in my mind for the labor and hadnt even thought about what a cesarean might invlove so it was all unexpected. Anyway, now ive fully recovered and enjoying motherhood. I wish you all well with your babies. Xx

question: Our darling daughter arrived 3 weeks ago by c section after labour was induced with no progress. The recovery afterwards had to be one of the worst things i have experienced in my life. Excruciating pain and discomfort.  Only now 3 weeks on can i start to enjoy my baby girl. I couldn't get out of bed for 2 days and then when i could it took days before i could walk again. Even when i left the hospital after 5 days i could hardly walk. I hated not being able to tend to my baby.What are your experiences of having a csection? Was recovery easier for you?I dont know how anyone would willingly  choose to have a csection. :(
